title: fschumann
author: fschumann
content: I just wanted to share some thoughts on the adoption of Bitcoin in general. I do believe, we are still very early. Most people do not even know what Bitcoin is or see it as a scam whatsoever. I think Bitcoin will easily see the $1.000.000 in the 2029 bull market. Now we have MSTR, Blackrock, Trump, and governments who plan to create Bitcoin reserves. We have never had that before. The 2025 bull run will be different from everything we have seen so far and it will probably continue until late 2025. Perhaps, we won't even be talking about Bitcoin in the future anymore, but about Satoshis, because it will be impossible to get a whole Bitcoin or even just 0.1 Bitcoin.  I do believe, holding 0.1 Bitcoin will be considered a significant amount in the future. You can probably buy a house with that amount of Bitcoin. Just think about where Bitcoin was 10 years ago. It really has just started since the 2021 bull run. I'm 17 years old, obviously missed the 2017 and 2021 bull run. But I have the opportunity to invest a couple thousand dollars this bull market, even though I'm not 18 yet. I will not miss that chance. I hope to be able to get 0.1 Bitcoin until the end of 2025.  My ultimate goal is to get 0.21 Bitcoin. However, for me being able to accumulate a whole coin, is already too late.I do this not only for me, but for my family. For my children and grandchildren. It might be scary to get started and investing thousands of dollars, you worked very hard for. But trusting the government is a thousand times worse in my opinion. Just look at the Euro or Dollar. The government can just print as much as they want. It's ridiculous. That's also why I'd never sell my Bitcoin, but just buy more and HODL. I don't care if it will drop 80% whatsoever. Because in the long term, it will increase in value. That's simple math. So I just wanted to share my opinion in general and think most of you would agree. P.S. if any of you has a job opportunity for me to earn some small amounts of Bitcoin, write me. Maybe you have a company and need some help, doesn't matter what.  I'm always interested in things like that.

comments.author: slapper
comments.body: The talk about "early" is both right and wrong. It's true that not many people are using Bitcoin, but its path isn't a straight line - it's a circle. . It's driven by halvings, media hype, and big players trying to trick the little guys. What's the difference now? There are more people and more money, but there is also more resistance. Not only do governments keep an eye on Bitcoin, they're afraid of it. As more people use it, they will fight back even more strongly by adding more rules and cracking downYour goal of 0.1 BTC (or 0.21)? Doable in every way. Just be persistent and follow through. But listen up: just adding sats isn't enough. Get good at the game. Lightning Network? Privacy tools? Self-custody? You have to have these; they're survival tools. Bitcoin isn't just something you can hold; it's also about freedom and safety that regular money can't provideAnd fiat? It's going down. From 2020, the US has created more than 50% of all the money in the world. That's crazy. Bitcoin doesn't just protect you from inflation; it gives you freedom. Getting rid of the middlemen and taking charge again. Think big, but start small. It will mean more than just wealth to have 0.21 BTC by 2029. It will mean you saw through the hype and had the guts to stick with it. That is the real move of power

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: I don’t think we’re massively early any more. I mean sure we are earlier than most but Bitcoin is now a legitimate, regulated financial product in the US. I don’t know if we can say that it’s still early now that there are Spot ETFs & especially if the US Gov declares a Bitcoin Strategic Reserve. It’s probably unrealistic for most people to reach 1 Bitcoin now though. As time passes getting to 0.1 will be rare too. So buy as much as you can whilst it’s still affordable.
